verses.text: The \w word|strong="H1697"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came again unto me, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*,
Now, thou \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w man|strong="H0120"\w*, take \w up|strong="H5375"\w* a \w lamentation|strong="H7015"\w* for \w Tyrus|strong="H6865"\w*;

And \w say|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Tyrus|strong="H6865"\w*, O thou that art \w situate|strong="H3427"\w* at the \w entry|strong="H3997"\w* of the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, \add which art\add* a \w merchant|strong="H7402"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* for \w many|strong="H7227"\w* \w isles|strong="H0339"\w*, Thus \w saith|strong="H0559"\w* the \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w* \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*; O \w Tyrus|strong="H6865"\w*, thou hast \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, I \add am\add* of \w perfect|strong="H3632"\w* \w beauty|strong="H3308"\w*.\f + \fr 27.3 \ft of perfect…: Heb. perfect of beauty\f*

Thy \w borders|strong="H1366"\w* \add are\add* in the \w midst|strong="H3820"\w* of the \w seas|strong="H3220"\w*, thy \w builders|strong="H1129"\w* have \w perfected|strong="H3634"\w* thy \w beauty|strong="H3308"\w*.\f + \fr 27.4 \ft midst: Heb. heart\f*

They have \w made|strong="H1129"\w* all thy \add ship\add* \w boards|strong="H3871"\w* of fir \w trees|strong="H1265"\w* of \w Senir|strong="H8149"\w*: they have \w taken|strong="H3947"\w* \w cedars|strong="H0730"\w* from \w Lebanon|strong="H3844"\w* to \w make|strong="H6213"\w* \w masts|strong="H8650"\w* for thee.\f + \fr 27.5 \ft made: Heb. built\f*

\add Of\add* the \w oaks|strong="H0437"\w* of \w Bashan|strong="H1316"\w* have they \w made|strong="H6213"\w* thine \w oars|strong="H4880"\w*; the \w company|strong="H1323"\w* of the \w Ashurites|strong="H0839"\w* have \w made|strong="H6213"\w* thy \w benches|strong="H7175"\w* \add of\add* \w ivory|strong="H8127"\w*, \add brought\add* out of the \w isles|strong="H0339"\w* of \w Chittim|strong="H3794"\w*.\f + \fr 27.6 \ft the company…: or, they have made thy hatches of ivory well trodden\f*\f + \fr 27.6 \ft company: Heb. daughter\f*

Fine \w linen|strong="H8336"\w* with broidered \w work|strong="H7553"\w* from \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w* was that which thou spreadest \w forth|strong="H4666"\w* to be thy \w sail|strong="H5251"\w*; \w blue|strong="H8504"\w* and \w purple|strong="H0713"\w* from the \w isles|strong="H0339"\w* of \w Elishah|strong="H0473"\w* was that which \w covered|strong="H4374"\w* thee.\f + \fr 27.7 \ft blue…: or, purple and scarlet\f*

The \w inhabitants|strong="H3427"\w* of \w Zidon|strong="H6721"\w* and \w Arvad|strong="H0719"\w* were thy \w mariners|strong="H7751"\w*: thy \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* \add men\add*, O \w Tyrus|strong="H6865"\w*, \add that\add* were in thee, were thy \w pilots|strong="H2259"\w*.

The \w ancients|strong="H2205"\w* of \w Gebal|strong="H1380"\w* and the \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* \add men\add* thereof were in thee thy \w calkers|strong="H0919"\w*: all the \w ships|strong="H0591"\w* of the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* with their \w mariners|strong="H4419"\w* were in thee to \w occupy|strong="H6148"\w* thy \w merchandise|strong="H4627"\w*.\f + \fr 27.9 \ft calkers: or, stoppers of chinks: Heb. strengtheners, etc\f*

They of \w Persia|strong="H6539"\w* and of \w Lud|strong="H3865"\w* and of \w Phut|strong="H6316"\w* were in thine \w army|strong="H2428"\w*, thy \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of \w war|strong="H4421"\w*: they \w hanged|strong="H8518"\w* the \w shield|strong="H4043"\w* and \w helmet|strong="H3553"\w* in thee; they set \w forth|strong="H5414"\w* thy \w comeliness|strong="H1926"\w*.

The \w men|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Arvad|strong="H0719"\w* with thine \w army|strong="H2428"\w* \add were\add* upon thy \w walls|strong="H2346"\w* round \w about|strong="H5439"\w*, and the \w Gammadims|strong="H1575"\w* were in thy \w towers|strong="H4026"\w*: they \w hanged|strong="H8518"\w* their \w shields|strong="H7982"\w* upon thy \w walls|strong="H2346"\w* round \w about|strong="H5439"\w*; they have \w made|strong="H3634"\w* thy \w beauty|strong="H3308"\w* \w perfect|strong="H3634"\w*.

\w Tarshish|strong="H8659"\w* \add was\add* thy \w merchant|strong="H5503"\w* by reason of the \w multitude|strong="H7230"\w* of all \add kind of\add* \w riches|strong="H1952"\w*; with \w silver|strong="H3701"\w*, \w iron|strong="H1270"\w*, \w tin|strong="H0913"\w*, and \w lead|strong="H5777"\w*, they \w traded|strong="H5414"\w* in thy \w fairs|strong="H5801"\w*.

\w Javan|strong="H3120"\w*, \w Tubal|strong="H8422"\w*, and \w Meshech|strong="H4902"\w*, they \add were\add* thy \w merchants|strong="H7402"\w*: they \w traded|strong="H5414"\w* the \w persons|strong="H5315"\w* of \w men|strong="H0120"\w* and \w vessels|strong="H3627"\w* of \w brass|strong="H5178"\w* in thy \w market|strong="H4627"\w*.\f + \fr 27.13 \ft market: or, merchandise\f*

They of the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of \w Togarmah|strong="H8425"\w* \w traded|strong="H5414"\w* in thy \w fairs|strong="H5801"\w* with \w horses|strong="H5483"\w* and \w horsemen|strong="H6571"\w* and \w mules|strong="H6505"\w*.

The \w men|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Dedan|strong="H1719"\w* \add were\add* thy \w merchants|strong="H7402"\w*; \w many|strong="H7227"\w* \w isles|strong="H0339"\w* \add were\add* the \w merchandise|strong="H5506"\w* of thine \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*: they \w brought|strong="H7725"\w* thee \add for\add* a \w present|strong="H0814"\w* \w horns|strong="H7161"\w* of \w ivory|strong="H8127"\w* and \w ebony|strong="H1894"\w*.

\w Syria|strong="H0758"\w* \add was\add* thy \w merchant|strong="H5503"\w* by reason of the \w multitude|strong="H7230"\w* of the wares of thy \w making|strong="H4639"\w*: they \w occupied|strong="H5414"\w* in thy \w fairs|strong="H5801"\w* with \w emeralds|strong="H5306"\w*, \w purple|strong="H0713"\w*, and broidered \w work|strong="H7553"\w*, and fine \w linen|strong="H0948"\w*, and \w coral|strong="H7215"\w*, and \w agate|strong="H3539"\w*.\f + \fr 27.16 \ft the wares…: Heb. thy works\f*\f + \fr 27.16 \ft agate: or, chrysoprase\f*

\w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, and the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, they \add were\add* thy \w merchants|strong="H7402"\w*: they \w traded|strong="H5414"\w* in thy \w market|strong="H4627"\w* \w wheat|strong="H2406"\w* of \w Minnith|strong="H4511"\w*, and \w Pannag|strong="H6436"\w*, and \w honey|strong="H1706"\w*, and \w oil|strong="H8081"\w*, and \w balm|strong="H6875"\w*.\f + \fr 27.17 \ft balm: or, rosin\f*

\w Damascus|strong="H1834"\w* \add was\add* thy \w merchant|strong="H5503"\w* in the \w multitude|strong="H7230"\w* of the wares of thy \w making|strong="H4639"\w*, for the \w multitude|strong="H7230"\w* of all \w riches|strong="H1952"\w*; in the \w wine|strong="H3196"\w* of \w Helbon|strong="H2463"\w*, and \w white|strong="H6713"\w* \w wool|strong="H6785"\w*.

\w Dan|strong="H2051"\w* also and \w Javan|strong="H3120"\w* going to and \w fro|strong="H0235"\w* \w occupied|strong="H5414"\w* in thy \w fairs|strong="H5801"\w*: \w bright|strong="H6219"\w* \w iron|strong="H1270"\w*, \w cassia|strong="H6916"\w*, and \w calamus|strong="H7070"\w*, were in thy \w market|strong="H4627"\w*.\f + \fr 27.19 \ft going…: or, Meuzal\f*

\w Dedan|strong="H1719"\w* \add was\add* thy \w merchant|strong="H7402"\w* in \w precious|strong="H2667"\w* \w clothes|strong="H0899"\w* for \w chariots|strong="H7396"\w*.\f + \fr 27.20 \ft precious…: Heb. clothes of freedom\f*

\w Arabia|strong="H6152"\w*, and all the \w princes|strong="H5387"\w* of \w Kedar|strong="H6938"\w*, they \w occupied|strong="H5503"\w* with \w thee|strong="H3027"\w* in \w lambs|strong="H3733"\w*, and \w rams|strong="H0352"\w*, and \w goats|strong="H6260"\w*: in these \add were they\add* thy \w merchants|strong="H5503"\w*.\f + \fr 27.21 \ft they occupied…: Heb. they were the merchants of thy hand\f*

The \w merchants|strong="H7402"\w* of \w Sheba|strong="H7614"\w* and \w Raamah|strong="H7484"\w*, they \add were\add* thy \w merchants|strong="H7402"\w*: they \w occupied|strong="H5414"\w* in thy \w fairs|strong="H5801"\w* with \w chief|strong="H7218"\w* of all \w spices|strong="H1314"\w*, and with all \w precious|strong="H3368"\w* \w stones|strong="H0068"\w*, and \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*.

\w Haran|strong="H2771"\w*, and \w Canneh|strong="H3656"\w*, and \w Eden|strong="H5729"\w*, the \w merchants|strong="H7402"\w* of \w Sheba|strong="H7614"\w*, \w Asshur|strong="H0804"\w*, \add and\add* \w Chilmad|strong="H3638"\w*, \add were\add* thy \w merchants|strong="H7402"\w*.

These \add were\add* thy \w merchants|strong="H7402"\w* in all \w sorts|strong="H4360"\w* \add of things\add*, in \w blue|strong="H8504"\w* \w clothes|strong="H1545"\w*, and broidered \w work|strong="H7553"\w*, and in \w chests|strong="H1595"\w* of rich \w apparel|strong="H1264"\w*, \w bound|strong="H2280"\w* with \w cords|strong="H2256"\w*, and made of \w cedar|strong="H0729"\w*, among thy \w merchandise|strong="H4819"\w*.\f + \fr 27.24 \ft all…: or, excellent things\f*\f + \fr 27.24 \ft clothes: Heb. foldings\f*

The \w ships|strong="H0591"\w* of \w Tarshish|strong="H8659"\w* did \w sing|strong="H7788"\w* of thee in thy \w market|strong="H4627"\w*: and thou wast \w replenished|strong="H4390"\w*, and made \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w glorious|strong="H3513"\w* in the \w midst|strong="H3820"\w* of the \w seas|strong="H3220"\w*.

¶ Thy \w rowers|strong="H7751"\w* have \w brought|strong="H0935"\w* thee into \w great|strong="H7227"\w* \w waters|strong="H4325"\w*: the \w east|strong="H6921"\w* \w wind|strong="H7307"\w* hath \w broken|strong="H7665"\w* thee in the \w midst|strong="H3820"\w* of the \w seas|strong="H3220"\w*.\f + \fr 27.26 \ft midst: Heb. heart\f*

Thy \w riches|strong="H1952"\w*, and thy \w fairs|strong="H5801"\w*, thy \w merchandise|strong="H4627"\w*, thy \w mariners|strong="H4419"\w*, and thy \w pilots|strong="H2259"\w*, thy \w calkers|strong="H0919"\w*, and the \w occupiers|strong="H6148"\w* of thy \w merchandise|strong="H4627"\w*, and all thy \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of \w war|strong="H4421"\w*, that \add are\add* in thee, and in all thy \w company|strong="H6951"\w* which \add is\add* in the \w midst|strong="H8432"\w* of thee, shall \w fall|strong="H5307"\w* into the \w midst|strong="H3820"\w* of the \w seas|strong="H3220"\w* in the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* of thy \w ruin|strong="H4658"\w*.\f + \fr 27.27 \ft and in…: or, even with all\f*\f + \fr 27.27 \ft midst of the seas: Heb. heart, etc\f*

The \w suburbs|strong="H4054"\w* shall \w shake|strong="H7493"\w* at the \w sound|strong="H6963"\w* of the \w cry|strong="H2201"\w* of thy \w pilots|strong="H2259"\w*.\f + \fr 27.28 \ft suburbs: or, waves\f*

And all that \w handle|strong="H8610"\w* the \w oar|strong="H4880"\w*, the \w mariners|strong="H4419"\w*, \add and\add* all the \w pilots|strong="H2259"\w* of the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, shall come \w down|strong="H3381"\w* from their \w ships|strong="H0591"\w*, they shall \w stand|strong="H5975"\w* upon the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*;

And shall cause their \w voice|strong="H6963"\w* to be \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* against thee, and shall \w cry|strong="H2199"\w* \w bitterly|strong="H4751"\w*, and shall cast \w up|strong="H5927"\w* \w dust|strong="H6083"\w* upon their \w heads|strong="H7218"\w*, they shall \w wallow|strong="H6428"\w* themselves in the \w ashes|strong="H0665"\w*:

And they shall make themselves \w utterly|strong="H7144"\w* \w bald|strong="H7139"\w* for thee, and \w gird|strong="H2296"\w* them with \w sackcloth|strong="H8242"\w*, and they shall \w weep|strong="H1058"\w* for thee with \w bitterness|strong="H4751"\w* of \w heart|strong="H5315"\w* \add and\add* \w bitter|strong="H4751"\w* \w wailing|strong="H4553"\w*.

And in their \w wailing|strong="H5204"\w* they shall take \w up|strong="H5375"\w* a \w lamentation|strong="H7015"\w* for thee, and \w lament|strong="H6969"\w* over thee, \add saying\add*, What \add city is\add* like \w Tyrus|strong="H6865"\w*, like the \w destroyed|strong="H1822"\w* in the \w midst|strong="H8432"\w* of the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*?

When thy \w wares|strong="H5801"\w* went \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* out of the \w seas|strong="H3220"\w*, thou \w filledst|strong="H7646"\w* \w many|strong="H7227"\w* \w people|strong="H5971"\w*; thou didst \w enrich|strong="H6238"\w* the \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* of the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w* with the \w multitude|strong="H7230"\w* of thy \w riches|strong="H1952"\w* and of thy \w merchandise|strong="H4627"\w*.

In the \w time|strong="H6256"\w* \add when\add* thou shalt be \w broken|strong="H7665"\w* by the \w seas|strong="H3220"\w* in the \w depths|strong="H4615"\w* of the \w waters|strong="H4325"\w* thy \w merchandise|strong="H4627"\w* and all thy \w company|strong="H6951"\w* in the \w midst|strong="H8432"\w* of thee shall \w fall|strong="H5307"\w*.

All the \w inhabitants|strong="H3427"\w* of the \w isles|strong="H0339"\w* shall be \w astonished|strong="H8074"\w* at thee, and their \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* shall be \w sore|strong="H8178"\w* \w afraid|strong="H8175"\w*, they shall be \w troubled|strong="H7481"\w* in \add their\add* \w countenance|strong="H6440"\w*.

The \w merchants|strong="H5503"\w* among the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* shall \w hiss|strong="H8319"\w* at thee; thou shalt be a \w terror|strong="H1091"\w*, and never \add shalt be\add* any \w more|strong="H5704"\w*.\f + \fr 27.36 \ft a terror: Heb. terrors\f*\f + \fr 27.36 \ft never…: Heb. shalt not be for ever\f*
